parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To give orders (injunctions, instructions, commands). From en and the base of telos; to enjoin.
To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
A papyrus roll. A diminutive of biblos; a roll.
Neuter of a adjective from a derivative of aphistemi; properly, something separative, i.e. divorce.
From apo and luo; to free fully, i.e. relieve, release, dismiss, or let die, pardon or divorce.
